column4: Well how do I make it just stop using it up? Windows never gave me these problems. I switched because i was sick of the crashing. Other then that Windows is the best with ram
What I'm saying is. I can be on the computer for like 10min. Fast and perfect. Then like 10min later. It's slower than hell and it's annoying
using all your ram is a feature, not a bug. unused ram is wasted ram.
linux uses the extra ram you have to do useful things like disk caching
it's not the reason your computer is becoming slow (the kernel 'using up' all your ram)
did you check the cpu/memory usage of the applications? which application is being a hog?
linux is. again, this has nothing to do with the linux kernel
type top, and figure out which process is slowing things down
it will list all the processes, sorted by cpu use. you should also look at memory use
how much cpu & mem is it using
you could tyr installing iotop and see if anything is makign al ot of disk access
this does not appear to be a ram issue. i don't know why you are convinced it is
